fr.sii.ogham.sms.sender.impl.cloudhopper.session

Class BaseSessionHandlingStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.sms.sender.impl.cloudhopper.session.BaseSessionHandlingStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable, SessionHandlingStrategy
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlwaysNewSessionStrategy, KeepSessionAliveStrategy, MayReuseSessionStrategy

    public abstract class BaseSessionHandlingStrategy
extends Object
implements SessionHandlingStrategy
    Base class for different session handling strategies.

    It provides useful methods to initialize a client and a session. It provides a method to connect (bind) to the SMSC with retry handling. It also provides method to cleanup. The implementations can then use this methods as they wish.

    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • initSession

        protected void initSession()
                    throws SmppException
        Initializes a new session only if session doesn't exist (is null).

        A SmppClient instance must exist (either using initClient() or by manually creating it). The same SmppClient may be used several times for different sessions.

        The creation of a session is done by calling connect(SmppClient).

        Throws:
        SmppException - when session couldn't be created

      • connect

        protected com.cloudhopper.smpp.SmppSession connect(com.cloudhopper.smpp.SmppClient client)
                                            throws SmppException
        Connect the client to the SMSC using a SmppClient.bind(com.cloudhopper.smpp.SmppSessionConfiguration, com.cloudhopper.smpp.SmppSessionHandler) request.

        The configured retry strategy is used to send the bind request to the server i.e. several attempts may be done.

        Parameters:
        client - the client used to send to bind command
        Returns:
        the created session
        Throws:
        SmppException - when the session couldn't be bound

      • initClient

        protected void initClient()
        Create a SmppClient instance of not existing (is null).

      • destroySession

        protected void destroySession()
        Send an unbind command to the server to properly close the session, close the session and cleanup everything related to the session. The current session is set to null.

      • destroyClient

        protected void destroyClient()
        Destroy (cleanup everything) the client. The client is set to null.
